title: Luke Chapter 8 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 8 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 8 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 8.

questions.question: Who was healed of seven devils according to Luke 8?
questions.correctAnswer: Mary called Magdalene
questions.explanation: Luke 8:2 mentions Mary called Magdalene, out of whom went seven devils.

questions.question: What did the sower sow in the parable told by Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: Seed
questions.explanation: Luke 8:5 states the sower went out to sow his seed.

questions.question: According to Luke 8, what happened to the seed that fell by the wayside?
options: It was trodden down and devoured by fowls
It grew into a large tree
questions.correctAnswer: It was trodden down and devoured by fowls
questions.explanation: Luke 8:5 describes the seed falling by the wayside being trodden down and devoured by the fowls of the air.

questions.question: What is the seed in the parable explained by Jesus?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: Luke 8:11 explains that the seed is the word of God.

questions.question: Who are those that hear the word by the wayside and have it taken away by the devil?
options: Those who hear but do not believe
Those who keep the word in an honest heart
Those who bear fruit with patience
Those who love riches and pleasures
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hear but do not believe
questions.explanation: Luke 8:12 describes those by the wayside as hearing the word, then the devil takes it away so they do not believe and be saved.

questions.question: According to Luke 8, what happens to the seed that falls on the rock?
options: It withers away because it lacks moisture
It grows strong and produces fruit
questions.correctAnswer: It withers away because it lacks moisture
questions.explanation: Luke 8:6 states the seed on the rock springs up but withers away due to lack of moisture.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say are His mother and brethren?
options: Those who hear the word of God and do it
The women who ministered to Him
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hear the word of God and do it
questions.explanation: Luke 8:21 records Jesus saying His mother and brethren are those who hear the word of God and do it.

questions.question: What did Jesus do when a storm arose while He was on the ship?
options: He rebuked the wind and the raging water and it became calm
He told the disciples to row harder
He woke the disciples and told them to jump into the water
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked the wind and the raging water and it became calm
questions.explanation: Luke 8:24 shows Jesus rebuking the wind and water, causing the storm to cease.

questions.question: What was the name of the man possessed by many devils?
questions.correctAnswer: Legion
questions.explanation: Luke 8:30 states the man’s name was Legion because many devils had entered into him.

questions.question: What happened to the swine after the devils entered them?
options: They ran violently down a steep place into the lake and were choked
They were sold by the herdsmen
questions.correctAnswer: They ran violently down a steep place into the lake and were choked
questions.explanation: Luke 8:33 describes the swine rushing down into the lake and drowning after the devils entered them.

questions.question: What did the woman who had an issue of blood do to be healed?
options: Touched the border of Jesus' garment
Asked Jesus to heal her openly
Was brought to Jesus by friends
questions.correctAnswer: Touched the border of Jesus' garment
questions.explanation: Luke 8:44 says the woman touched the border of Jesus' garment and was immediately healed.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus allowed everyone to enter the house when he raised Jairus’ daughter.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 8:51 states Jesus allowed only Peter, James, John, and the parents to enter the house.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told the woman with the issue of blood that her faith had made her whole.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 8:48 quotes Jesus telling her her faith made her whole.

questions.question: True or False: When Jairus' daughter was dead, Jesus said she was not dead but sleeping.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 8:52 shows Jesus saying she is not dead but sleepeth.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Luke 8:16: 'No man, when he hath lighted a candle, covereth it with a _______, or putteth it under a bed.'
questions.correctAnswer: vessel
questions.explanation: Luke 8:16 uses 'vessel' in this context to describe what is not used to cover a candle.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 8 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 8 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged because their faith seems weak and they are tempted to give up. Based on the parable of the sower in Luke 8, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance through trials?
options: Those who receive the word with a good and honest heart will keep it and bring forth fruit with patience
Faith is only for the strong and perfect believers
Temptations mean you are not chosen by God
Only those who never experience trials are truly faithful
questions.correctAnswer: Those who receive the word with a good and honest heart will keep it and bring forth fruit with patience
questions.explanation: Luke 8:15 teaches that those on good ground, with an honest and good heart, keep the word and bring forth fruit with patience. This encourages perseverance through trials and temptations. See also Luke 8:13-15 for the contrast with other types of hearers.

questions.question: How does Luke 8 teach about the importance of faith in God's power when Jesus calms the storm?
options: Jesus rebuked the wind and water and asked, 'Where is your faith?'
The disciples controlled the storm with their prayers
Jesus said storms are a punishment for sin
Faith is not necessary for safety
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rebuked the wind and water and asked, 'Where is your faith?'
questions.explanation: In Luke 8:24-25, Jesus calms the storm and questions the disciples about their faith, teaching that faith in God's power is essential even in fearful situations.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to respond when they face worries about wealth and pleasures tempting them away from God. What does Luke 8 say about the effect of such distractions on spiritual growth?
options: Cares, riches, and pleasures choke the word, preventing fruitfulness
Wealth is a sign of God's blessing and should be pursued above all
Pleasures are always a blessing from God and cause no harm
questions.correctAnswer: Cares, riches, and pleasures choke the word, preventing fruitfulness
questions.explanation: Luke 8:14 explains that those who hear the word but are choked by cares, riches, and pleasures do not bring fruit to perfection, illustrating the danger of worldly distractions.

questions.question: How does Luke 8 illustrate the importance of actively hearing and doing God's word within family and community life?
options: Jesus said those who hear and do God's word are His true family
Blood relations determine who belongs to God's family
Only religious leaders are part of God's family
Family ties have no spiritual significance
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus said those who hear and do God's word are His true family
questions.explanation: In Luke 8:19-21, Jesus redefines family as those who hear the word of God and do it, emphasizing obedience over biological ties in spiritual fellowship.

questions.question: What practical lesson about faith and healing can be learned from the woman who touched Jesus' garment in Luke 8?
options: Faith in Jesus' power brings immediate healing
Healing depends on the number of physicians consulted
Touching Jesus' garment was a superstition
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in Jesus' power brings immediate healing
questions.explanation: Luke 8:43-48 shows that the woman's faith caused her immediate healing, and Jesus affirms this by saying, 'thy faith hath made thee whole.'

questions.question: What does Luke 8 teach about humility and contentment through the story of the healed man from the Gadarenes?
options: The healed man was told to return home and testify about God's works
He was told to follow Jesus everywhere
He was told to seek riches and fame
He was told to isolate himself from the community
questions.correctAnswer: The healed man was told to return home and testify about God's works
questions.explanation: Luke 8:38-39 shows Jesus instructing the man to go back to his own house and declare what great things God has done, emphasizing humble testimony and gratitude.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 8, Jesus performed miracles only to impress large crowds without teaching about faith.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus performed miracles to reveal God's power and to teach about faith and trust, as seen in calming the storm (Luke 8:24-25) and healing the demon-possessed man (Luke 8:35).

questions.question: How does Luke 8 emphasize the importance of spiritual vigilance and attentiveness?
options: Jesus says, 'Take heed therefore how ye hear'
Believers should ignore teachings they find difficult
Only leaders need to be attentive to God's word
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus says, 'Take heed therefore how ye hear'
questions.explanation: Luke 8:18 warns believers to be careful how they hear the word, highlighting the need for spiritual vigilance and understanding.

questions.question: A believer struggles with doubt during a crisis. Based on Luke 8, what encouragement can you give about trusting God even when circumstances seem hopeless?
options: Jesus encouraged Jairus to 'Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole'
Doubt means God has abandoned you
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus encouraged Jairus to 'Fear not: believe only, and she shall be made whole'
questions.explanation: Luke 8:50 shows Jesus encouraging Jairus to have faith despite the apparent hopelessness of his daughter's condition, teaching trust in God's power.

questions.question: What does the parable of the sower in Luke 8 teach about the importance of integrity and honesty in receiving God's word?
options: Those with an honest and good heart keep the word and produce fruit with patience
Only outward appearances matter in faith
Integrity is irrelevant to receiving God's word
questions.correctAnswer: Those with an honest and good heart keep the word and produce fruit with patience
questions.explanation: Luke 8:15 explains that good ground represents those with honest and good hearts who retain and act on God's word, emphasizing integrity in faith.

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 8, Jesus valued family relationships above obedience to God’s word.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 8:21 shows Jesus stating that those who hear and do God's word are His true family, indicating obedience to God is higher than biological ties.

questions.question: When Jesus said, 'He that hath ears to hear, let him hear,' what does Luke 8 suggest about the attitude believers should have towards God's word?
options: Believers should listen attentively and seek understanding
God’s word is a secret for only a few
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should listen attentively and seek understanding
questions.explanation: Luke 8:8 and 8:10 emphasize the importance of attentiveness and understanding in receiving God's word, encouraging believers to listen carefully.

questions.question: What does the story of the woman healed of a 12-year issue of blood teach about personal devotion and faith in Jesus’ power?
options: Faith in Jesus' power leads to healing even after long suffering
Only public displays of faith matter
Faith is ineffective after many years
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in Jesus' power leads to healing even after long suffering
questions.explanation: Luke 8:43-48 shows the woman's faith, despite long suffering and expense, brought immediate healing, highlighting persistent faith and personal devotion.

questions.question: How does Luke 8 encourage believers to be a witness in their communities through the example of the healed demoniac?
options: The healed man went and published throughout the city what Jesus had done
He kept the healing a secret
questions.correctAnswer: The healed man went and published throughout the city what Jesus had done
questions.explanation: Luke 8:39 records that the man who was healed testified to the great things Jesus had done, showing the importance of sharing the Gospel with others.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said that no man, when he hath lighted a candle, __________.
options: covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed
hides it in a secret place
puts it out in the rain
questions.correctAnswer: covereth it with a vessel, or putteth it under a bed
questions.explanation: Luke 8:16 teaches that light is meant to be visible and shared, symbolizing the openness with which believers should live out their faith.

hard.title: Luke Chapter 8 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 8.

questions.question: In Luke 8, the parable of the sower uses different types of soil to represent responses to the word of God. Which soil type represents those who hear the word but are quickly tempted away due to lack of root?
questions.correctAnswer: The rock
questions.explanation: Luke 8:13 explains that those on the rock are they which receive the word with joy but have no root and fall away in time of temptation.

questions.question: Which woman mentioned in Luke 8 was healed from seven devils?
questions.correctAnswer: Mary called Magdalene
questions.explanation: Luke 8:2 states Mary called Magdalene was healed of seven devils.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the seed in the parable of the sower according to Jesus in Luke 8?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: Jesus explains in Luke 8:11 that the seed is the word of God.

questions.question: In Luke 8, who are described as those that hear the word but are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures and bring no fruit to perfection?
questions.correctAnswer: Those among thorns
questions.explanation: Luke 8:14 identifies those that fall among thorns as those choked by cares, riches, and pleasures.

questions.question: According to Luke 8, why did Jesus speak in parables to the crowds but explain the mysteries of the kingdom to his disciples?
options: So that some would see and others would not
To fulfill a prophecy in Psalms
questions.correctAnswer: So that some would see and others would not
questions.explanation: Luke 8:10 explains that Jesus used parables so that seeing they might not see, and hearing they might not understand.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about a candle in Luke 8 and its proper use?
options: It should be covered with a vessel
It should be hidden under a bed
It should be set on a candlestick so all may see the light
It should be extinguished at night
questions.correctAnswer: It should be set on a candlestick so all may see the light
questions.explanation: Luke 8:16 states no one lights a candle to cover it or put it under a bed but sets it on a candlestick so that those who enter may see the light.

questions.question: Who does Jesus identify as his mother and brethren in Luke 8?
options: Those who hear the word of God and do it
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hear the word of God and do it
questions.explanation: In Luke 8:21, Jesus says his mother and brethren are those who hear the word of God and do it.

questions.question: During the storm on the lake in Luke 8, what does Jesus do to calm the storm?
options: He rebukes the wind and the raging water
He commands the disciples to row
questions.correctAnswer: He rebukes the wind and the raging water
questions.explanation: Luke 8:24 records Jesus rebuking the wind and the raging water, causing a calm.

questions.question: What is the name given by the demon-possessed man to Jesus in Luke 8?
questions.correctAnswer: Legion
questions.explanation: Luke 8:30 states the man’s name was Legion, because many devils had entered him.

questions.question: What cultural significance might the herd of swine have had in the story of the demon-possessed man in Luke 8?
options: Swine were considered unclean animals in Jewish culture
They were the main source of food for the Gadarenes
They were sacred animals to the locals
questions.correctAnswer: Swine were considered unclean animals in Jewish culture
questions.explanation: Swine were unclean to Jews, so sending demons into swine (Luke 8:32-33) emphasizes the severity and unclean nature of the possession.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus' command to the healed demon-possessed man to 'return to thine own house and shew how great things God hath done unto thee' in Luke 8?
options: It highlights the importance of personal testimony
It was a way to avoid crowds
It was a command to become a disciple
It meant to leave the country immediately
questions.correctAnswer: It highlights the importance of personal testimony
questions.explanation: Luke 8:39 commands the man to testify in his own city about the great things God has done, indicating the role of witness in spreading the Gospel.

questions.question: In the healing of the woman with the issue of blood, what Greek word is translated as 'virtue' that Jesus perceives leaving him when touched?
questions.correctAnswer: Dunamis
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'dunamis' (Luke 8:46) conveys power or miraculous ability, showing Jesus’ awareness that power had gone out from him.

questions.question: How does the reaction of the crowd to Jairus’s daughter being called 'sleeping' by Jesus in Luke 8 illustrate a literary device common in the New Testament?
options: Irony, as they know she is dead but Jesus calls it sleep
Paradox, because she is both dead and alive
questions.correctAnswer: Irony, as they know she is dead but Jesus calls it sleep
questions.explanation: Luke 8:52 shows Jesus calling death sleep, which the crowd mocks, illustrating irony and foreshadowing resurrection.

questions.question: True or False: In Luke 8, Jesus allows everyone to enter the room when he raises Jairus’s daughter from the dead.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Luke 8:51 states Jesus permitted only Peter, James, John, and the parents of the girl to enter.

questions.question: What theme in Luke 8 is emphasized by Jesus’s repeated command to 'hear' and the description of different responses to the word of God?
options: The necessity of active faith and perseverance
The rejection of the Law of Moses
The coming of the Messiah as a political king
questions.correctAnswer: The necessity of active faith and perseverance
questions.explanation: The parable and Jesus’s calls to hear (Luke 8:8, 18) emphasize faith that perseveres and produces fruit in response to God’s word.

theological.title: Luke Chapter 8 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 8 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: In Luke 8, what is the symbolic meaning of the seed in the parable of the sower?
questions.correctAnswer: The word of God
questions.explanation: Luke 8:11 clearly states that the seed is the word of God. This symbolism aligns with Old Testament passages such as Isaiah 55:10-11 where God's word accomplishes His purpose, and New Testament teachings like Romans 10:17 which emphasize hearing the word as the basis of faith.

questions.question: According to Luke 8, what happens to those who hear the word by the wayside?
options: The devil takes away the word from their hearts
They hide the word under a vessel
questions.correctAnswer: The devil takes away the word from their hearts
questions.explanation: Luke 8:12 explains that those who hear by the wayside have the word taken away by the devil to prevent belief and salvation. This is consistent with 1 Peter 5:8 about the devil seeking to devour believers and Ephesians 6:16 on the shield of faith to extinguish the fiery darts of the evil one.

questions.question: Which group in the parable of the sower represents those who receive the word with joy but have no root and fall away during temptation?
questions.correctAnswer: Those on the rock
questions.explanation: Luke 8:13 identifies the rock as those who receive the word with joy but have no root, falling away when tested. This reflects themes in Hebrews 3:12-13 warning against unbelief and James 1:6-8 about double-mindedness leading to instability.

questions.question: What do the thorns symbolize in the parable according to Luke 8?
options: Cares, riches, and pleasures of life
questions.correctAnswer: Cares, riches, and pleasures of life
questions.explanation: Luke 8:14 states that the thorns represent the cares, riches, and pleasures of life which choke the word and prevent it from bearing fruit. This corresponds to teachings in 1 John 2:15-17 about the love of the world and Mark 4:19 which also explains the choking effect of worldly concerns.

questions.question: Who does Jesus identify as His true mother and brothers in Luke 8?
options: Those who hear the word of God and do it
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hear the word of God and do it
questions.explanation: In Luke 8:21, Jesus redefines His family as those who hear and obey God's word, underscoring the spiritual family of faith. This theme resonates with Matthew 12:48-50 and John 15:14 emphasizing obedience as the basis of belonging to Christ.

questions.question: What does Jesus rebuke to calm the storm on the lake?
options: The wind and the raging of the water
questions.correctAnswer: The wind and the raging of the water
questions.explanation: Luke 8:24 describes Jesus rebuking the wind and raging water, demonstrating His authority over nature. This echoes Psalm 107:29 and Mark 4:39, affirming His divine sovereignty over creation.

questions.question: What is the name of the man possessed by many demons in the country of the Gadarenes?
questions.correctAnswer: Legion
questions.explanation: Luke 8:30 reveals the man’s name as 'Legion' because many demons entered him, signifying a multitude. This term also appears in Mark 5:9, indicating the same event and highlighting the reality of demonic oppression in biblical theology.

questions.question: What did the demons request Jesus not to do after entering the herd of swine?
options: Command them to go into the deep
Allow the man to follow Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Command them to go into the deep
questions.explanation: Luke 8:31 shows the demons begging Jesus not to send them into the deep (abyss). This reflects the biblical concept of the abyss as a place of confinement for evil spirits (Revelation 20:1-3) and demonstrates Jesus’ authority over demonic realms.

questions.question: What miracle is performed on the woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years?
options: She is immediately healed after touching Jesus’ garment
Jesus prays over her and heals her
She is healed after washing in the pool of Siloam
questions.correctAnswer: She is immediately healed after touching Jesus’ garment
questions.explanation: Luke 8:44 records that the woman’s bleeding stopped immediately when she touched Jesus’ garment, illustrating faith's power and Jesus’ healing authority. This aligns with Matthew 9:20-22 and Mark 5:25-34, reinforcing Christ’s compassion and divine power.

questions.question: What does Jesus say to the woman healed of the issue of blood regarding her faith?
options: Thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace
Be healed in the name of the Father
questions.correctAnswer: Thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace
questions.explanation: Luke 8:48 highlights that Jesus attributes her healing to her faith, affirming the doctrine that faith is instrumental in receiving salvation and healing (Ephesians 2:8-9, Hebrews 11:6). This underscores faith as trust in God's power.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the death of Jairus' daughter when he arrives at her house?
options: She is not dead but sleepeth
questions.correctAnswer: She is not dead but sleepeth
questions.explanation: In Luke 8:52, Jesus calls her death 'sleep,' indicating the temporary nature of physical death and his power over it. This metaphor is consistent with John 11:11-14 and 1 Thessalonians 4:13-14, affirming the Christian hope of resurrection.

questions.question: What command does Jesus give to Jairus' daughter to restore her to life?
questions.correctAnswer: Maid, arise
questions.explanation: Luke 8:54 records Jesus commanding 'Maid, arise,' to restore her life, demonstrating His messianic authority over death. This event prefigures the resurrection power revealed in John 11 and affirms Jesus as the source of life (John 14:6).

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give concerning how people hear the word in Luke 8?
questions.correctAnswer: Take heed how ye hear
questions.explanation: Luke 8:18 instructs to be careful how one hears because the measure of understanding affects what is given or taken away. This aligns with Proverbs 4:20-21 on attentive hearing and James 1:22-25 about being doers, not just hearers.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about hiding a light after it is lit, as recorded in Luke 8?
options: No man puts it under a bed or vessel but sets it on a candlestick
Light should be hidden to avoid persecution
Only priests can display the light
Light must be covered at night
questions.correctAnswer: No man puts it under a bed or vessel but sets it on a candlestick
questions.explanation: Luke 8:16 teaches that light is meant to be displayed openly, symbolizing the visible testimony of faith. This teaching corresponds to Matthew 5:14-16 on believers being the light of the world and Exodus 27:20-21 regarding the lampstand in the tabernacle.

questions.question: Why did the people of the Gadarenes ask Jesus to depart after the healing of the demon-possessed man?
options: They were seized with great fear
They wanted to follow Him to Galilee
They were angry about the loss of the swine
questions.correctAnswer: They were seized with great fear
questions.explanation: Luke 8:37 states the people begged Jesus to leave because they were greatly afraid, reflecting human fear of divine power. This reaction is consistent with Old Testament responses to God's presence (Exodus 20:18) and New Testament reverence (Acts 9:31).
